text: The beauty one can find in art is one of the pitifully few real and lasting products of human endeavor.
author: Paul Getty

text: Only when inspired to go beyond consciousness by some extraordinary insight does beauty manifest unexpectedly.
author: Arthur Erickson

text: I think exercise tests us in so many ways, our skills, our hearts, our ability to bounce back after setbacks. This is the inner beauty of sports and competition, and it can serve us all well as adult athletes.
author: Peggy Fleming

text: Ugliness is in a way superior to beauty because it lasts.
author: Serge Gainsbourg

text: I've never had any illusions about being a lead actor in films, because lead actors have to be of a certain kind. Apart from the beauty of looks and figure, which I cannot claim to have, there's just a particular kind of ordinary-Joe quality that a film star needs to have.
author: Stephen Fry
